meanings.definition: To make a raid or brief invasion.
meanings.sent1: The cat was foraying into the neighbor's yard for adventure.
meanings.sent2: The pirates were foraying into the coastal town for treasure.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was foraying into the bird feeder for a snack.
meanings.sent4: The detective was foraying into the suspect's alibi for inconsistencies.
meanings.sent5: The explorer was foraying into the dense jungle for hidden ruins.

meanings.definition: A quick raid or brief invasion.
meanings.sent1: The foraying of the bandits left the village in chaos.
meanings.sent2: The foraying of the bees into the garden was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The foraying of the raccoons into the trash cans was a nightly occurrence.
meanings.sent4: The foraying of the storm into the city caused widespread damage.
meanings.sent5: The foraying of the tourists into the local market brought a burst of energy.
